segment.source: Network access Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network access Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Network access Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Network access Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts security policy setting.

segment.source: Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts
segment.target: Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which additional permissions will be assigned for anonymous connections to the device.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which additional permissions will be assigned for anonymous connections to the device.

segment.source: Windows allows anonymous users to perform certain activities, such as enumerating the names of domain accounts and network shares.
segment.target: Windows allows anonymous users to perform certain activities, such as enumerating the names of domain accounts and network shares.

segment.source: This is convenient, for example, when an administrator wants to give access to users in a trusted domain that does not maintain a reciprocal trust.
segment.target: This is convenient, for example, when an administrator wants to give access to users in a trusted domain that does not maintain a reciprocal trust.

segment.source: This policy setting has no impact on domain controllers.
segment.target: This policy setting has no impact on domain controllers.

segment.source: Misuse of this policy setting is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.
segment.target: Misuse of this policy setting is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.

segment.source: No additional permissions can be assigned by the administrator for anonymous connections to the device.
segment.target: No additional permissions can be assigned by the administrator for anonymous connections to the device.

segment.source: Anonymous connections will rely on default permissions.
segment.target: Anonymous connections will rely on default permissions.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Even with this policy setting enabled, anonymous users will have access to resources with permissions that explicitly include the built-in group, ANONYMOUS LOGON (on systems earlier than Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista).
segment.target: Even with this policy setting enabled, anonymous users will have access to resources with permissions that explicitly include the built-in group, ANONYMOUS LOGON (on systems earlier than Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista).

segment.source: This policy has no impact on domain controllers.
segment.target: This policy has no impact on domain controllers.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: An unauthorized user could anonymously list account names and use the information to perform social engineering attacks or attempt to guess passwords.
segment.target: An unauthorized user could anonymously list account names and use the information to perform social engineering attacks or attempt to guess passwords.

segment.source: Social engineering attackers try to deceive users in some way to obtain passwords or some form of security information.
segment.target: Social engineering attackers try to deceive users in some way to obtain passwords or some form of security information.

segment.source: Enable the Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts setting.
segment.target: Enable the Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts setting.

segment.source: It is impossible to grant access to users of another domain across a one-way trust because administrators in the trusting domain are unable to enumerate lists of accounts in the other domain.
segment.target: It is impossible to grant access to users of another domain across a one-way trust because administrators in the trusting domain are unable to enumerate lists of accounts in the other domain.

segment.source: Users who access file and print servers anonymously are unable to list the shared network resources on those servers; the users must be authenticated before they can view the lists of shared folders and printers.
segment.target: Users who access file and print servers anonymously are unable to list the shared network resources on those servers; the users must be authenticated before they can view the lists of shared folders and printers.
